title: AIML - Developer Experience Engineering Manager, Machine Learning Platform & Infrastructure
description:
SummaryPosted: Jan 8, 2025Role Number:200585956Do you want to lead a team that builds scalable, cutting-edge infrastructure powering Apple Intelligence? The AIML Search and Foundation Model Platform team is pioneering the next generation of search, AI and machine learning. Our platform forms the core of Apple Intelligence, supporting critical products and services across Apple, including Music, App Store, TV, News, Spotlight, Safari, Siri, and many more exciting products in the pipeline. Each day, we process millions of user queries with exceptional performance, fully leveraging our advanced hardware to deliver seamless user experiences.

As part of this team, you‚Äôll engage with one of the most sophisticated computing environments in the world, handling millions of transactions per second. You‚Äôll actively contribute to building the developer platform and optimizing the developer experience for our search and foundation model platform, and making it more flexible, scalable and cost efficient, as it adapts to high demand user needs, fast growing traffic, and rapidly evolving search and AI technologies across Apple's global ecosystem.DescriptionAs the Developer Experience Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of highly-skilled engineers building the developer platform, which is responsible for code management, functional testing, performance testing, release management and the underlying production infrastructure, for Apple‚Äôs search and foundation model platform. You‚Äôll manage the strategic direction and day-to-day operations of this team and be responsible for optimizing developer experience. You‚Äôll work closely with cross-functional teams, including product teams, platforms teams, SRE teams and stakeholders, to deliver innovative, robust, and efficient solutions that support Apple‚Äôs vision of intelligent search across its ecosystem of products.

You‚Äôll be responsible for fostering a collaborative and innovative environment while ensuring the team is aligned with the broader technical vision and business goals. Your team will focus on designing, building and operating the platform for developers and optimizing their experience to enable rapid product iteration and innovation, while maintaining reliability and scalability at every level. Your true passion on developer experience and infrastructure will be critical to the success of this role.Minimum QualificationsProven engineering leadership experience in large scale distributed sytem or a related fieldExperience managing and growing engineering teams, providing mentorship, career development, and technical guidanceStrong communication skills with a demonstrated ability to collaborate across teams and manage relationships with stakeholdersAbility to balance long-term strategic thinking with short-term project execution and team priorities10+ year experience on large scale distributed system design, operation and optimization and cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, etc.)Strong technical skills with an ability to dive deep into architectural challenges when neededBS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experiencePreferred QualificationsExperience with engineering productivity related technologies (release infrastructure, testing infrastructure, etc)Experience with search infrastructure or machine learning infrastructureExperience with cluster management and optimizationPay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $208,300 and $360,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.

Apple

We‚Äôre a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what‚Äôs possible to help us all do what we love in new ways.

View all jobs at Apple

Apply now Apply later

Posted 1 week ago

Summary

Posted: Jan 8, 2025

Role Number:200585956

Do you want to lead a team that builds scalable, cutting-edge infrastructure powering Apple Intelligence? The AIML Search and Foundation Model Platform team is pioneering the next generation of search, AI and machine learning. Our platform forms the core of Apple Intelligence, supporting critical products and services across Apple, including Music, App Store, TV, News, Spotlight, Safari, Siri, and many more exciting products in the pipeline. Each day, we process millions of user queries with exceptional performance, fully leveraging our advanced hardware to deliver seamless user experiences. As part of this team, you‚Äôll engage with one of the most sophisticated computing environments in the world, handling millions of transactions per second. You‚Äôll actively contribute to building the developer platform and optimizing the developer experience for our search and foundation model platform, and making it more flexible, scalable and cost efficient, as it adapts to high demand user needs, fast growing traffic, and rapidly evolving search and AI technologies across Apple's global ecosystem.

Description


As the Developer Experience Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of highly-skilled engineers building the developer platform, which is responsible for code management, functional testing, performance testing, release management and the underlying production infrastructure, for Apple‚Äôs search and foundation model platform. You‚Äôll manage the strategic direction and day-to-day operations of this team and be responsible for optimizing developer experience. You‚Äôll work closely with cross-functional teams, including product teams, platforms teams, SRE teams and stakeholders, to deliver innovative, robust, and efficient solutions that support Apple‚Äôs vision of intelligent search across its ecosystem of products. You‚Äôll be responsible for fostering a collaborative and innovative environment while ensuring the team is aligned with the broader technical vision and business goals. Your team will focus on designing, building and operating the platform for developers and optimizing their experience to enable rapid product iteration and innovation, while maintaining reliability and scalability at every level. Your true passion on developer experience and infrastructure will be critical to the success of this role.

Minimum Qualifications


  • Proven engineering leadership experience in large scale distributed sytem or a related field
  • Experience managing and growing engineering teams, providing mentorship, career development, and technical guidance
  • Strong communication skills with a demonstrated ability to collaborate across teams and manage relationships with stakeholders
  • Ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with short-term project execution and team priorities
  • 10+ year experience on large scale distributed system design, operation and optimization and cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, etc.)
  • Strong technical skills with an ability to dive deep into architectural challenges when needed
  • BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent experience


Preferred Qualifications


  • Experience with engineering productivity related technologies (release infrastructure, testing infrastructure, etc)
  • Experience with search infrastructure or machine learning infrastructure
  • Experience with cluster management and optimization


Pay & Benefits


  • At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $208,300 and $360,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

    Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

    Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.



  • Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.




Apply now Apply later
